From my understanding the naming scheme of Kopernicus, which RSS now uses, is its own unique scheme, so a different planet represents venus than than the planet that represented venus before RSS used Kopernicus, which was the planet Eve. Now I think it might be Dres or something.

From my understanding the naming scheme of Kopernicus, which RSS now uses, is its own unique scheme, so a different planet represents venus than than the planet that represented venus before RSS used Kopernicus, which was the planet Eve. Now I think it might be Dres or something.

Yep that's true I think while seen the RSS Kopernicus cfg and yeah Venus is now Dres but called like Venus. I was trying conbinations of codes but still no clouds so I don't really know. I'm seeing other mods that use Kopernicus and have a EVE config

Yep that's true I think while seen the RSS Kopernicus cfg and yeah Venus is now Dres but called like Venus. I was trying conbinations of codes but still no clouds so I don't really know. I'm seeing other mods that use Kopernicus and have a EVE config

Yes, thanks for looking into this. I understand C# but I don't yet understand the workings of KSP atmospheres and such. I haven't the time to dive into such things to date. I'm curious how difficult it is for us to convert RVE to Kopernicus.
https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/issues/27
Looks cool keep up the good work !

https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/issues/27

Ok, so your saying that Kopernicus allows Celestial Body renaming and main menu renaming. But you can't rename for PQS and scaled space. So What naming type of those is EVE using? Celestial body or the PQS? Are we to use the renamed RSS actual real name of the planets? Or is EVE to use the KSP stock names?
I tried to make clouds for gas giants, but from long distances (for ex. from Mimas) they looks strange because dark patches start to move into atmospheres

I tried to make clouds for gas giants, but from long distances (for ex. from Mimas) they looks strange because dark patches start to move into atmospheres

Can you explain how you created clouds for RVE, or post a file?

pditty8811: Yeah, last time I checked, EVE tries to find a scaled space transform of the same name as the celestial body. Obviously that will fail for Earth. Instead, it should get the scaled space transform on the same gameobject as the celestial body monobehaviour is a component on.

The other issue is the one regarding shaders.

Well, it's my simplified my own mod (really I created special beauty mod for stock, New Horizons and RSS, last one is not ready), almost everywhere (on big planets) I put atmosphere, somewhere they are deactivated.

I use ksp 1.0.2 with upgraded unity to x64, it's almost like 1.0.2 but more stable and can use win 7/8

By the way, I can see the same black dots on Jool in intestellar, but it's not too easy to notice them. damned shaders!

Well, it's my simplified my own mod (really I created special beauty mod for stock, New Horizons and RSS, last one is not ready), almost everywhere (on big planets) I put atmosphere, somewhere they are deactivated.

I use ksp 1.0.2 with upgraded unity to x64, it's almost like 1.0.2 but more stable and can use win 7/8

By the way, I can see the same black dots on Jool in intestellar, but it's not too easy to notice them. damned shaders!

Can confirm that Alexoff's mod does indeed work. It also has rings around Saturn (perhaps that was already added by 10.1 RSS and I didn't notice). Great job Alexoff and of course Nathan.

I'm a bit confused. I thought RSS has all the ground textures, and the atmosphere files are already within Alexoff's mod?
Nope, RVE uses EVE Overhaul to add lots of ground detail textures.
